_header: Listen man if thou wilt hear / Of thing that is bothe digne & dear
Note:
Part of the ‘Continuation’ of Handlyng Synne (1283), for which see Sullivan (1978)
XSullivan, S. A. “Handlyng Synne in Its Tradition: A Study of Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Handlyng Synne and Its Relation to Other Instructional Works, in Order to Establish the Place of the Poem in Its Genre.” Diss. Cambridge, 1978. Other sections are 378, 1598, 3340, 3355, 3358.
_description: The Seven Sacraments, illustrated by exempla — 456 lines in couplets

CULIi49.First Lines:
Lyste man if þu wylt hereOf thyng þat is boþe digne
                    & dere…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Cryste graunt vs grace alle þat it so be
                    soAmen Amen for charyte
CULIi49.Attributed Title:
Hic incipiunt Vij Sacramenta ecclesie In Remissionem omni peccatorum
                    (f. 177); Expliciunt Vij Sacramenta ecclesie (f. 185)

BLHar3954.First Lines:
Lystyn man & þou xalt hereOf thyng þat is boþe
                    dygne & dere…
BLHar3954.Last Lines:
…Cryst graunt vs alle þat it so beAmen amen for
                    charyte

Hic incipiunt VIJ sacramenta ecclesie in remisionem omnium
